alert.note: Alert for Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Glacier Bay; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:46AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...POTENTIALLY VERY WINDY WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL INNER CHANNELS AND THE EASTERN GULF COAST... Gusty winds increase Wednesday night to 40 to 50 mph and could approach 60 mph by early Thursday morning. Confidence has increased that strong winds will occur, but we are still uncertain on just how high they become. The time period with the highest likelihood of peak wind gusts would fall between midnight Wednesday night and 6 AM Thursday morning. However, gusty winds will begin earlier Wednesday and persist through much of Thursday.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Glacier Bay; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area
